Class Virus

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.biology.Virus
public class Virus extends Object
Represents a virus - an infectious agent that replicates inside living cells.

Viruses are not true living organisms as they cannot reproduce independently. They contain genetic material (DNA or RNA) and use host cells for replication.

Lifecycle stages:

  • DORMANT - Outside host, in capsid form
  • ATTACHMENT - Binding to host cell receptor
  • PENETRATION - Entering host cell
  • REPLICATION - Using host machinery to replicate
  • ASSEMBLY - New virions being assembled
  • RELEASE - Exiting host cell (lysis or budding)

Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

    • Virus

      public Virus(String name, String family, Virus.GenomeType genomeType, Virus.Morphology morphology, BioSequence genome, double capsidDiameterNm)
      Creates a new Virus.
      Parameters:
      name - common or scientific name
      family - virus family (e.g., Coronaviridae)
      genomeType - type of genetic material
      morphology - capsid shape
      genome - genetic sequence
      capsidDiameterNm - diameter in nanometers
